sentences.en: Abnormal rearward curvature of the spine, resulting in protuberance of the upper back ; hunchback.
sentences.cn: 脊柱后凸,驼背脊椎不正常地向后弯曲, 导致背部上方凸出;驼背.

sentences.en: After the hunchback had made the fire for me I inquired about the grub.
sentences.cn: 待驼背替我生好了火,我便向他打听吃的.

sentences.en: Clopin was making fun of him, and the hunchback was angry.
sentences.cn: 克洛潘取笑他, 驼背人不由得怒气冲天.

sentences.en: His best - known works are the novels Les Mis é rables and Notre - Dame de Paris ( movie: The Hunchback of Notre - Dame ).
sentences.cn: 他最著名的两部作品是小说《悲惨世界》和《巴黎圣母院》 ( 电影: 钟楼怪人 ).

sentences.en: I will kick your butt so high; you look like a hunchback.
sentences.cn: 我要把你的屁股踢的老高, 让你像钟楼怪人一样.

sentences.en: Popular tradition portrays Richard III as a hunchback.
sentences.cn: 流行的传说把理查三世描绘成驼子.

sentences.en: Quasimodo moves into the bell tower of a cathedral and becomes the hunchback of Notre Dame.
sentences.cn: 卡西莫多搬进了一座天主教堂的钟楼里，成了巴黎圣母院的敲钟驼背人。

sentences.en: Quasimodo was a wise and kindhearted guy, but he had an ugly face and a hunchback.
sentences.cn: 长大后的加西莫多善良聪明, 但他却是个样貌奇丑面容可怖的驼子.

sentences.en: The hunchback in the corner by the wall exulted.
sentences.cn: 壁角的驼背忽然高兴起来。

sentences.en: When I looked down the hall I saw what looked like a transparent hunchback limping toward us.
sentences.cn: 我向下看，看到一个驼背的跛子向我们走来。

trans.tran_en: an offensive word for someone who has a large raised part on their back because their  spine  curves in an unusual way
